name: Abbey Ales Brewery
description:
Founded in 1997, Abbey Ales is the first and only brewery in the historic City of Bath for over forty years, and is the initiative of experienced brewery sales and marketing manager Alan Morgan.

Bellringer is the only cask beer continuously produced at the Abbey Brewery, a golden 4.2% abv best bitter.

Successfully launched at the Bath CAMRA beer festival in October 1997 Bellringer is now the top selling cask bitter in the World Heritage City of Bath and is as popular with the many visitors to the Georgian City as it is with Bathonians.

name: Amherst Brewing Company
description: Amherst Brewing Company is a full-service brewpub located in downtown Amherst, Massachusetts. Our 10-Barrel brewery is visible from the bar and produces some of the finest ales and lagers for serving in our 150-seat restaurant and 100-seat lounge and game room. Brewery tours can be made by appointment. Our giant, brass-top bar seats over 30 people and is fully stocked, including Single Malt Scotches and Small Batch Bourbons. An additional 40 seats are available on our seasonal patio; the best place in town to relax and enjoy an ABC draft or specialty brew while watching passersby. --From Amherst Website

name: Angel City Brewing
description:
Angel City Brewery is excited to be part of the brewing renaissance of Downtown LA by bringing old-world, small-batch, craft brewing to the new world of the expanding Arts District. We are committed to the continued growth and revitalization of our neighborhood by being an interactive and supportive partner to the arts and business communities, as well as the burgeoning craft beer movement in Los Angeles.

Angel City Brewing was founded in 1997. Starting modestly, Angel City quickly became a leader in the LA craft beer scene. In 2004 Angel City bought an 8,000 barrel German-made brewery in Alpine Village near Los Angeles on EBay! and lovingly restored the facility. In late 2010, Angel City relocated the brewery to the historic John A. Roebling Building in LA’s Downtown Arts District. The vision was, and remains, to give this great city a great brewery.

On January 5, 2012, Angel City Brewery was acquired by Alchemy & Science, a craft beer collaboration led by Alan Newman and Stacey Steinmetz, formerly of Magic Hat Brewing Company.

Since January 2012, we’ve undergone massive renovations, including the addition of a new mustache bar. We began brewing in April of 2012, and started popping up in local LA bars and restaurants soon thereafter.

In February 2013, we opened the doors to the Brewery and Public House, but with limited hours as construction continued. We offer an ever-rotating selection of Angel City beer on tap, which includes a number of beers exclusively available at the Brewery. In addition to pints and flights, we offer brewery tours, events, and a great place to gather with friends. We have a small on-site retail store as well. Outside food is always welcome, and there are a number of great locations in our neighborhood that offer take out. In addition to the neighborhood cuisine, our parking lot has become a hot spot for food trucks, with one parked outside nearly every night we’re open. On May 5th, 2013 we had our grand opening with our first ever Heritage Festival. We’re now seven days a week for brewery tours and tastings, and we have full roster of weekly events.

name: Atomic Ale Brewpub and Eatery
description: Founded by Aaron Burks in 1997, Atomic Ale Brewpub & Eatery is the Tri-Cities’ first brewpub. We feature a distinctive menu cooked in the Tri-Cities’ original wood-fired oven to complement our fresh, full-flavored handcrafted ales. Set in an atmosphere that reflects the rich history of the Mid-Columbia basin and the Hanford Site, we work hard to provide an exceptional dining experience.

name: Atwater Brewery
description: Atwater Block Brewery, founded in 1997, is housed in a 1916 factory warehouse located in Detroit's historic Rivertown district. Brewing relentlessly on our imported Kaspar Schultz system, we've ridden the wave of aggressive ales while holding true to our German roots through our traditional Lagers. With drinkability and tradition at heart, it's easy for us to "Drink Our Share and Sell the Rest"!

name: Barley Brothers Restaurant & Brewery
description:
Barley Brothers restaurant and brewery is an upscale-casual eatery known for its extensive menu, great music, and award winning draft beer. From classic lagers to more obscure ales and stouts there's a draft beer flavor for everyone. Our American cuisine menu includes an impressive selection of appetizers, salads, pastas, sandwiches, wood fired pizzas, ribs and rotisserie chicken. Barley Brothers plays America’s favorite - classic rock and an abundance of flat screens showcase the day's sports and special events.

Barley Brothers is part of the Shugrues Restaurant and Brewery Group. Restaurants are located Lake Havasu City, and Sedona Arizona.

There is something for everyone at the Barley Brothers.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Beach Chalet Brewery and Restaurant
description:
The Beach Chalet Brewery & Restaurant is located above the Golden Gate Park Visitor's Center which features the amazing and historic WPA frescoes created by Lucien Labaudt in the 1930's. The artwork captures the flavor of San Francisco in that era in a style of the Arts and Crafts movement – a must see for fans of the style and for anyone who wants a taste of the strange and incredible period in which the WPA allowed art projects like this to exist during such hard times.

Upstairs you will find the Beach Chalet Brewery & Restaurant. It was developed by Gar and Lara Truppelli and Timon Malloy in 1997 after the Chalet had sat vacant for 17 years. To remodel and restore this historic building to its former glory so it could be a landmark to be enjoyed by future generations as well as to create a space for their restaurateurs’ dreams, they brought Heller Manus Architects onboard to help make their dreams a reality.

Today thousands of guests enjoy the Modern American Cuisine menu and hand crafted ales. The Beach Chalet offers a full bar, abundant free parking and a breathtaking ocean view. Bay Area residents and visitors find the Beach Chalet to be a wonderful San Francisco experience while visiting Golden Gate Park and Ocean Beach. Join us and find out why the Beach Chalet is your kind of place.

name: Bent River Brewing
description: Unique neighborhood brewery restaurant in "old" downtown historic district. We offer the midwest's best award- winning craft beers, a great selection of pub grub and one of the coolest beer gardens in the Quad Cities.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 3:00 am

name: Blue Corn Brewery
description: Blue Corn Brewery is a mid sized brewpub in Santa Fe New Mexico. All the beer at Blue Corn is brewed on a one manned 7 barrel brew house. There are four 7 barrel fermenters and one 15 barrel fermenter. The 15 barrel is used exclusively for the Road Runner IPA, our most popular beer. Our Head Brewer, John Bullard uses the finest ingredients from around the world to make a wide variety of ales and lagers. Blue Corn Brewery has 6 house beers and 4 rotating specialty beers. Blue Corn Brewery also specializes in Northern New Mexican cuisine.

locations.name: Cerrillos Road
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Brasserie des Franches-Montagnes
description: Brasserie des Franches-Montagnes, also known by the abbreviation BFM is a small artisanal brewery in Jura, Switzerland whose products, including barrel-aged beers, have drawn international acclaim. Founded in 1997 by Jérôme Rebetez, who had formerly been trained as an oenologist, this tiny brewery has rapidly become known for making beers that stretch traditional beer style guidelines and use unorthodox ingredients. BFM's products are made in small batches and hand-packaged at the brewery.

name: Brewerkz
description:
Founded in 1997, Singapore’s award-winning microbrewery restaurant, Brewerkz Restaurant & Microbrewery, was the brain-child of US-born Devin Otto Kimble and Daniel Flores, who initially modeled it after similar concepts in the USA and Canada. 

The iconic full-service restaurant features high quality American-style food and a full range of premium beers handcrafted on-site from the 10 hl microbrewery attached to the restaurant.

Most notable attraction of the restaurant is the distinctly featured custom-made microbrewery built by Newlands Systems Inc in Abbotsford, BC Canada. Equipped with specially fabricated fermentation tanks that have been designed to minimize floor-space needs, the brewing system produces over 2,500 hl of beer per annum, nearly all of which is drunk at both Brewerkz locations and their sister concept Café Iguana.

name: Brewery Ommegang
description: In October of 1997, not far from the birthplace of baseball, ground was broken for what was to become America's most unique craft brewery. Based on traditional Belgian farmhouse architecture and set on a former hop farm in upstate New York, Brewery Ommegang was born with the philosophy that truly unique ales must be built from the ground up. Now brewing six award-winning Belgian-style ales, an imaginative range of seasonal and limited edition ales, and offering daily tours and tastings, plus a full calendar of special events, Brewery Ommegang is the place where brewing is an art and partaking is a passion.

locations.name: Brewery Ommegang
locations.hoursOfOperation:
11am-6pm (summer hours)
12-5pm (winter hours)

name: Buckeye Brewing Company
description: Buckeye Brewing began brewing in 1997. The flagship beer, Hippie IPA, was first bottled in 1998. We are one of only three breweries bottling in Cleveland, OH. While well known for hoppy Pale and IPA, other styles shine as well. Buckeye produces everything from German-style Kolsch to Belgian-style Saison. Buckeye’s bottled products can be found in quality bottle shops across Ohio. Buckeye currently brews on a 15 barrel Century brew house. Stay tuned for updates on our front page.

name: Carolina Beer Company
description:
January 2011 - Carolina Beer & Beverage will not be selling Carolina Blonde and Cottonwood products and tastings will no longer be offered effective immediately. Kegs may be obtained from Foothills Brewery in W/S and Charlotte retailers such as Total Wine, Fruggles, Mike's Beverage, and other "Better beer stores". Blonde and Cottonwood Bottled beer are carried at many stores/restaurants- just ask for Carolina Blonde and Cottonwood.

Carolina Beer & Beverage, LLC was founded in 1997 by CEO J. Michael Smith and President John Stritch. The company is the creator and maker of a dozen, high-quality, craft beers sold and distributed in five Mid-Atlantic States under the Carolina Blonde and Cottonwood Ales brands. In 2001, the company expanded its operations to offer contract packaging services after being recognized as one of the first craft breweries in the country to utilize PET packaging for its beers.

Today, the company has a reputation as a world-class co-packing producer for numerous national and international beverage brands. With an emphasis on co-packing specialty-sized cans, specialty plastic bottles and glass bottles, the company's customers include the who's who in the beverage world, including makers of well known malt beverages, distilled spirits, energy drinks and other ready-to-drink beverages.

The company's state-of-the-art facility in Mooresville, N.C. has a current capacity of 35 plus million cases annually, including the latest in high-speed can filling, batching, tunnel pasteurization and laboratory technologies.

name: Chinggis Beer Brewery
description:
Our atmost goal is become well respected brand in the Asiapacific region.

In 1998, “Chinggis beer “LLC was the landmark in the history of Mongolian Beer market supplying high quality beer brewed according to the quality control stature or famous “ Reinheitsgebot” , Beer Purity law of Germany.

name: Cool Beer Brewing Company
description:
Cool Beer Brewing Company was founded in 1997 by Bobby Crecouzos. His ambition was simple: to brew only the highest quality beer, made with the best ingredients, using absolutely no preservatives, additives or chemicals.

From the beginning, Cool didn’t focus on marketing and promotions. The Company concentrated on the product and the brewing process. Headquartered in Brampton, Ontario, the once-tiny Brewery grew steadily as its Cool Beer brand became increasingly successful. So much so, Cool had to expand its operations a number of times.

But the commitment to quality never changed.

By 2003, Cool was sufficiently well-established for the Brewery to launch another high-quality beer, new Millennium Buzz Beer. Buzz is a refreshing red lager which has also proved to be a resounding success.

Both Cool and Buzz will always be made with the finest ingredients, contain no additives whatsoever, and be put through the Brewery’s advanced cold-filtration system that makes them two of the most refreshing and thirst-quenching beers available. Judging by their success, a commitment to quality still pays off!

name: Custom Brewcrafters, Inc.
description:
Custom BrewCrafters introduced to the market in 1997 an innovative micro-brewing concept in which they have partnered with dozens of local restaurant and tavern owners in offering unique signature craft-brews custom designed for each establishment.

In addition to adding this new dimension to the Western New York beer market, Custom BrewCrafters opened a tasting room and gift shop at the brewery in Honeoye Falls, where we introduce the public to the many unique custom brews as well as educate them on craft beer and microbrewing.

name: Dillon Dam Brewery
description:
The Dillon Dam Brewery is the Largest Brewpub in the Colorado Rockies and one of the largest Brew-Pubs in the nation as well as one of the best family restaurants in Summit County, Colorado.

We serve signature, seasonal, session and big beers -- primarily ales and lagers -- and we brew over 1,700 barrels per year. WE have a 13-tap system. This makes us the 37th largest Brew-Pub in the nation (out of nearly 1,000). That's a lot of Dam Beer™.

We are an American-style restaurant serving lunch, dinner, and a kids menu. Our extensive menu has over 70 items to choose from. We serve the families of and visitors to Dillon, Silverthorne, Frisco, Keystone, Breckenridge and Copper Mountain.

We are also an easy stop-off for those traveling west to Vail, Steamboat Springs and Aspen or east to Denver. In fact we are a great stop for anyone traveling I-70.

name: F&M Brewery
description: Founded in 1997, F&M is a rennaissance brewer of premium ales and lagers. Brewed under the brand name Stonehammer, after our flagship pilsner lager we offer three main brands, two seasonal beers, and contract brew the Maclean's Pale Ale.

name: Florida Beer Company
description: Headquartered in beautiful Cape Canaveral, FL. Florida Beer Company is Florida's state of the art brewery. With 17 years of brewing tradition, Florida Beer Company produces some of Florida's finest craft beer from its new 60,000 sq.ft. facility. Locals and visitor's to Florida's East Coast can enjoy handcrafted favorites like Swamp Ape DIPA, Florida Lager, Devil's Triangle IPA and Sunshine State PILS.

name: Founders Brewing Company
description:
Founders Brewing Company, founded by Mike Stevens and Dave Engbers produced its first beer in November of 1997. Built out of a dream and a passion for home brewing, what started out as a hobby quickly became a thriving business.  As the years have passed, Founders has built its brewery on the exploration of recipe development and brewing techniques. We are not the standard micro-brewery, rather we have traveled a path that breaks from the standard craft-brewer.

Carving a niche out of the craft industry, Founders Brewing Company has built its reputation on producing very unique beers. Our focus is to offer our wholesalers, retailers and consumers a product that stands alone on the shelf and offers a true drinking experience to our friends, the consumer.  As the years have passed, Founders has built its brewery on the exploration of recipe development and brewing techniques. We are not the standard micro-brewery, rather we have traveled a path that breaks from the standard craft-brewer. Carving a niche out of the craft industry, Founders Brewing Company has built its reputation on producing very unique beers. Our focus is to offer our wholesalers, retailers and consumers a product that stands alone on the shelf and offers a true drinking experience to our friends, the consumer.

name: Fox River Brewing Company
description: Dating back to 1846, the city of Oshkosh has deep roots in brewing fine beers http://oshkoshbeertimeline.blogspot.com/. Fox River Brewing Company opened on the Fox River in Oshkosh, late 1995. Under the name of Fratellos (meaning brothers) and Fox River Brewing Co., the Supple Brothers, long-standing restaurateurs, dove into the brewing industry.

name: Garrison Brewing Company
description:
Garrison Brewing Company will strive to create premium, full-flavored beer that fully deserves the pride and support of Halifax and Nova Scotia residents alike. We will remain focused at all times on quality control, customer satisfaction, sound business practices and increasing shareholder value.

All of our beers are 100% vegan, and preservative free. With the exception of our Wheat beers which are duly noted in the name, all of our beers are 100% wheat free.

name: Gordon Biersch Brewing
description: In 1997, Gordon Biersch opened a state-of-the-art brewery and bottling facility in San Jose, CA in order to begin bottling and distributing its famed, German-style beers. Today, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company is a brewing industry leader with 22 years of experience and counting. The microbrew trend continues to grow, and the company is actively expanding its distribution nationwide. Since 1998, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company has more than doubled its production, increasing its capacity to 3.1 million gallons of beer annually, making Gordon Biersch Brewing Company the largest brewery in the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Green Man Brewing Company
description: The ancient legend of the Green Man influenced our brewery's inception in 1997. As one of Asheville's oldest breweries, we are proud to craft some of the beer scene's most iconic ales. Loyalty to traditional brewing techniques while creating innovative ales is Green Man's constant quest.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: The tasting room is open seven days a week at 4 o'clock, or maybe earlier

name: High Desert Brewing Co.
description: After years of recipe development, remodeling, and parking lot paving, the High Desert Brewing Co. opened it's doors in July of 1997 and has quickly become one of New Mexico's premier brewpubs. Our selection of hand crafted lagers and ales are produced on premises using the finest grains and hops. We brew small batches of about 100 gallons, ensuring that each beer is served at the peak of freshness. Our brews are available by the glass, pint, or pitcher and to-go in 1/2 gallon growlers and 5 gallon kegs. We make every attempt to keep all of our beers on tap at all times but once in a while one or two may not be available for a few days. These times are the perfect opportunity to stretch your taste and try something other than your favorite. Please let Bob or Donna, or any of the High Desert Brewing Co. staff know how you think we are doing.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Sat:  11am - Midnight
Sun:  Noon - 10pm

name: Houston Brewing Company
description:
The Houston Brewing Company is a brewery in the village of Houston in Renfrewshire, Scotland. It is attached to, and operated in common with, the Fox & Hounds public house.

It produces a constant range of seven cask condition ales, alongside a range of seasonal and bottled beers

locations.name: Houston Brewing Company
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am
Sun: 12:00 pm - 12:00 pm

name: Ice Harbor Brewing Co
description: Established in 1997, Ice Harbor Brewing Company is dedicated to producing award-winning beers for people who love beer.

name: Itchen Valley Brewery
description:
Founded in 1997 by two businessmen at the Christening of their Godson Dugald Rhodes. The Godfathers, pleased with their honorary responsibility, thought carefully for the future of little Dugald.

Several pints of mediocre ale later the idea for forming a brewery and making their own beer began to take hold. A toast was made and within weeks a site (wholly inadequate) was found and the equipment (too big for the site) was bought.

The first brew, Godfathers, won the Bronze Award for best ale in Britain the following year at the Great British Beer Festival.

16 years, 30 million pints and a brewery relocation later IVB continues to thrive. Situated in the heart of Hampshire we produce an unrivalled range of award winning real ales with pure Hampshire water, yeast and barley along with the finest hops around the country and world.

Godson Dugald is as yet too young to enjoy his beer birthright, but we’re sure he will.

name: J.J. Bitting Brewing Company
description:
Established in 1997, J.J. Bitting Brewing Company was the first brewery to operate in Woodbridge Township, New Jersey, since the repeal of prohibition in 1933. Our spacious 3 story restaurant resides in a beautifully restored 100 year old brick building that once housed The J.J. Bitting Coal and Feed Depot.  

During your visit, indulge in the finest American Grill Cuisine and Handcrafted Beer and Ales offered by our chef and master brewer while soaking in the vibrant and rustic environment the restaurant that has awarded us the distinction of “#2 Brew Pub In America” by BeerAdvocate.com and "Best Hot Wings" by besthotwings.com

name: Just Beer Brewing Co.
description: Brewer of american grown beer.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Store Hours: Saturdays from 11am to 5pm. Tastings, growler fills, bottle sales.

name: Keltek Brewery
description: The Keltek Brewery is a multi award winning Brewery situated in Redruth, Cornwall.

name: Kennebec River Pub & Brewery
description:
The Kennebec River Pub & Brewery is located at Northern Outdoors Adventure Resort in the North Woods logging village of The Forks, Maine. Northern Outdoors is New England's most diverse and accessible adventure destination, offering an authentic outdoor experience and first class amenities in any season. The brewery began pouring pints for thirsty woodcutters, rafters, hikers, snowmobilers and tourists at the resort, in January 1997.

Kennebec River beers are unfiltered and all natural, with no preservatives, additives or stabilizers. We handcraft our beers with the utmost care, using the finest malted barley, premium domestic and imported hops, superior yeasts, and pure water. Good flavorful beer, brewed in small batches right here in the North Woods of Maine! Cheers!

name: La Barberie
description:
Based in Quebec, microbrewery La Barberie since 1997 excels in the art of brewing premium beers to delight your taste buds!

Open daily from 12:00 to 1:00 AM, the tasting room (along the terrace in summer) offers regular rotation in a selection of eight beers varying the days and seasons. A small area set can accommodate groups of less than 25 people.

To your health!

locations.name: La Barberie
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am

name: Live Oak Brewing Company
description: Live Oak Brewing Company is truly a home-grown Austin enterprise. Two of Austin's own homebrews, Chip McElroy and Brian Peters, literally hand-built the brewery and were the two main brewers, keg washers, delivery persons, and proselytizers. Live Oak has grown since then, but we are still just as passionate about providing delicious old-world style beers that are rarely commercially available. Our special beers are brewed in limited quantities in a small east Austin brewery and are available in fine pubs and restaurants in Austin, Dallas, Houston, Alpine, Marathon, San Marcos and San Antonio.

name: Magnolia Brewing Company
description: Brewery and gastropub in San Francisco's Haight Ashbury District with a new production brewery and BBQ restaurant, Smokestack,now open in the Dogpatch neighborhood.

name: Main Street Brewery
description: Our Brew pub can seat around 150 people. We have a full bar with nine beers micro brews on tap, we also serve some domestic beer as well as some local wine. We have a down stairs game room with pool tables, foosball table, air hockey and a couple arcade games. We open at 11:00 A.M. Daily for lunch and we start serving dinner at 3:30 P.M. Until 10:00 p.m. then it's pizza in the bar! Come in on Sundays and watch the football games and other available sporting events!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Winter Hours- 11:30 to close Friday Saturday Sunday Monday for lunch and dinner 3:30 to close- DAILY for dinner

name: Mariner Brewing Company
description:
"The Adventure Starts Here."

Brewer of small batch hand-crafted ales.

Mission - Mariner Brewing Company pledges to continually endeavor to brew finely crafted beer, while forever maintaining a strong sense of fun and adventure.

name: Market Street Brewing Company
description: Market Street Brewing Co. & Restaurant was founded in June of 1997 by Theresa and Pelham McClellan. Located on historic Market Street in downtown Corning, NY the brewpub embodies the essence of the  microbrew revolution. With six fresh beers brewed right on premise, and delectable “upscale” menu, Market Street Brewing Co. & Restaurant provides only the finest food and drink to our estimable patrons. Open seven days a week with rooftop seating and a bier-garten to compliment our dining room, bring the family and enjoy Corning’s first brewpub.

name: McCoy's Public House and Brewkitchen
description:
Over 10 house brewed beers on tap at any given time served with American Comfort food with a twist.

We have been making beer for over 17 years and are one of the most popular brew pubs in the Kansas City area.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am
Sun: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Milwaukee Brewing Company
description:
The Milwaukee Brewing Company is the 'grown up' brewery name for the familiar Milwaukee Ale House in Milwaukee's Historic 3rd Ward.

The Ale House has always been brewing under the name Milwaukee Brewing Company. While we continue to brew at the Ale House, we have the 2nd Street Brewery located in Walkers Point.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:

Friday: 4pm, 5pm & 6pm
Saturday: 2pm, 3pm & 4pm
Open House from 5 to 7pm ($10)

name: Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery
description: Brewpub featuring full flavored ales and lagers. In addition to brewery location we offer 2 offsite tap houses with full food menus (one also features 10 lanes of bowling). Company wide we offer house ales and lagers  with a rapidly rotating seasonal list.

locations.name: Brewpub
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 1:00 am
Thu - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am
Sun: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Moor Beer Company
description:
Moor Beer Company brings you something different – a company dedicated to quality products, service to the community and social responsibility. We are not publicly traded and leave our accountability to the people that matter – our customers, employees, suppliers and families.

We strive to produce strongly flavoured beers of exceptional character. All our beers are brewed using only natural ingredients. We put a lot into our beers by using the finest malt, hops, yeast and water – but don’t take anything out. All our beers are unfiltered so they retain the yeast that is so vital to producing exceptional flavour, as well as providing vitamins.

name: Mountain Goat
description:
Dave and Cam learned to be persistent. Really persistent. They finally secured the required funds from friends, family and a business banker who wanted them out of his face.

Today the boys operate their very own microbrewery in Richmond (inner Melbourne). They craft the Hightail Ale, Organic Steam Ale plus seasonal beers in longnecks like the Surefoot Stout , IPA and Double Hightail.

“The plant is very labor intensive, but we can squeeze great beer out of it” says Dave. “And after hand filling, capping and labelling just on 2 million bottles you can well imagine we’re pretty happy about putting in a small, automated bottling line.”

Mountain Goat has collected a swag of awards over the years for their traditional, all natural ales and now has about 80 bars in Melbourne pouring their beers on tap plus bottled beer distributed nationally.

So why Mountain Goat? Well, a mountain goat’s a big hairy animal that’s never gonna fall over.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
We open the brewery to public every Friday evening from 5pm. 
We’re also open Wednesday nights from 5 and hold free brewery tours at 6.30 (no need to book for groups under 4). We’re usually in here brewing Wed nights so it’s a great opportunity to see the process happening and earbash a brewer.

name: Northwoods Brewpub and Grill
description:
Northwoods Brewpub and Grill brought the fine tradition of craft brewing to Eau Claire. Now the first microbrewery in west central Wisconsin is the place to be!

It’s all woodsy and warm in our lodge-like bar. Hang out with friends, shoot pool for free or melt into the comfy chairs in the lounge. Whether you want to let loose, play trivia or have an intimate conversation there’s a spot waiting for you. Did we mention the 14 tap beers? Your thirst stops here.

name: Offshore Ale Company
description: Offshore Ale Company is Martha's Vineyard's own brewery and restaurant, serving the island 7 days a week, year round since 1997. Located at 30 Kennebec Ave., Oak Bluffs, MA. 508-693-2626

name: Ohio Brewing Company
description:
Ohio Brewing Company is an award-winning microbrewery located in downtown Akron in the historic Selle building. Our brewery produces a wide array of styles, form German ales to Irish Red ales to Stouts and even Oktoberfest lagers.

The original Ohio Brewing Company was founded in 1997 in Niles, Ohio by current owner Chris Verich. Our current operation is a new venture by Chris in Akron, Ohio to produce these award-winning beers in a craft production brewery setting.

name: Old Boys' Brew House
description: Old Boys’ Brewhouse Restaurant was founded in 1997. With Melissa Brolick at the helm, Dave Bayes in the brewery, Dan Paquin in the kitchen along with our fantastic staff you can expect your experience to be spectacular and consistent.

name: Olde Saratoga Brewing Company
description:
Located in historical Saratoga Springs, New York, the Olde Saratoga Brewing Co. has been a well-kept secret in the city.

Established in 1997, it is the fourth largest brewery in New York State and produces the highest quality and freshest craft brewed ales and lagers in the area.

The company is owned by the Mendocino Brewing Company, which is based in California. The Olde Saratoga Brewery brews about 30 different kinds of beer throughout the year - over 20,000 barrels last year. A third of their business is through contract brewing for a variety of breweries throughout the Northeast . Contract beers allow the brewery to make a variety of unique beers from light beer to a white Belgian to dark Stout beer and also gives the public a chance to taste of variety of great beers throughout the year.

name: Original Sin
description: In 1997, Original Sin’s founder, Gidon Coll, set out on a mission to create a great American cider, both dry and natural. He extensively researched the history of cider and cider making and soon began sourcing the best apples and yeast strains. Supported by a local wine expert, he began mixing and testing in a small upstate New York winery, and brought his samples to NYC bars each week for feedback from owners, managers, and patrons. After six months, the first batch of O.S. was released to establishments in Brooklyn and Manhattan. Soon after, the product received critical acclaim from sources as diverse as The New York Times, New York Post, Paper Magazine, and Market Watch. Today, you can find our unique and acclaimed ciders in over half the country, with more regions being added every month.

name: Oskar Blues Brewery
description: Oskar Blues Brewery is part of the Oskar Blues Grill and Brew restaurant and was located in Lyons, Colorado, near the city of Boulder. The brewery is now in Longmont, CO - a much larger town just east of Lyons. Oskar Blues is unique in that it serves craft-brewed beer in cans, contrary to the normal practice of bottling micro brews. The brewery is owned by Dale Katechis, a native of Florence, Alabama who brought canned beer and southern fried foods together for an interesting twist on the micro-brew pub.

locations.name: Brevard
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Tasting Room
Monday-Sunday: 12pm-8pm

Free Brewery Tours
Monday-Thursday: 4pm
Friday-Sunday: 2pm, 3pm, 4pm, 5pm

name: Pale Ale Brewing Company
description: Formerly Tom Cat Brewing - segued into Rock Creek Brewing in 1999.

name: Propeller Brewery
description: Propeller Brewing Company is Nova Scotia’s best selling microbrewery. Our International award winning, all-natural, British-style ales and lagers are available at liquor stores, fine bars and restaurants throughout Nova Scotia. Ask for an Extra Special Bitter or an India Pale Ale, the Province's two best selling micro brewed beers, or drop by the downtown brewery and retail store to sample brewery fresh craft ales.

name: Prospect Brewery
description: Founded in 2007, Prospect Brewery is now one of the North West's leading independent real ale brewers. We are based in Standish near Wigan, a town with a strong mining history, and the brewery and the names of our beers are closely linked with the towns heritage and culture.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Monday-Friday: 09:30-16:30

name: R&B Brewing Company
description: R&B Brewing Co. has always been, and will always be, just about as independent of a microbrewery as you’ll come across. Founded in 1997 by longtime friends and co-workers Rick Dellow and Barry Benson (the ‘R’ & ‘B’, respectively), R&B Brewing Co. was set up to stand in opposition to what the beer world had become – big, non-descript, faceless, and corporate. Combining over 60 years of brewing experience with some of the big guys, Rick and Barry sought to create deliciously hand crafted ales and lagers that would bear no resemblance to the world of big beer. Full-bodied and distinctly rich beer, using only the choicest malts, hops and yeast, would be the focus of the product, while the co-owners personalities would blend to create the marketing milieu – edgy, young, independent…definitely East Van.

name: RJ Rockers Brewing Company
description:
RJ Rockers Brewing Company became Spartanburg's first brewery in 1997, when owner and brewer Mark Johnsen set out on a mission to provide the people of the Upstate with the best microbrewed beer they had ever tasted. Mark, a New Jersey native, had loved brewing beer for his friends and family for years.

Following his service in the 1991 Gulf War, Mark was stationed in Germany as a member of the United States armed forces, and he took this opportunity to learn as much as possible about brewing from the experts. By the time he was honorably discharged from the service, he was ready to take his beer to the public.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Tours & Tastings are every Thursday between 5pm and 7pm with tour offerings every half hour.

name: Rock Art Brewery
description:
Matt began the brewery in the basement of our home in 1997. Wow! I can't believe I let him do that! His first beer was Whitetail Ale. A nice crisp refreshing golden ale. I was really enjoying wheat beers at the time. I guess that's why I let him start Rock Art! The Brewery was ready to leave home and move to it's own place down the road in Morrisville, VT in 2001. We are still located there and now have a terrific space for people to come and visit. Come on by and say hello!

Our Mission is to offer our friends and family a wonderful beer at the end of the day!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
9:00 until 6:00 Monday-Saturday

TOURS: We have a wonderful viewing area upstairs and are happy to bring people up for a tour at 2:00 & 4:00 daily with a special tour at 11:00 a.m. on Saturday.
 
TASTINGS DAILY until 5:30

name: Russian River Brewing Company
description:
In 1997, Russian River Brewing Company (RRBC) was founded by Korbel Champagne Cellars in Guerneville, California. Vinnie Cilurzo was hired as the Brewmaster. At the Great American Beer Festival in 1999, RRBC and Vinnie were awarded "Small Brewing Company of the Year" and "Small Brewing Company Brewmaster of the Year." In 2002, Korbel decided to leave the beer business and sold the brewery to Vinnie and his wife, Natalie. The brewery is now located in Santa Rosa, California

At Russian River Brewing Company we focus on traditional aggressively hopped California style ales, Belgian style ales, and barrel aged beers. We brew a full line up of ales and lagers for our pub and for limited distribution.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu:	11:00 am - 12:00 am
Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:00 am
Sun:	11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Sam Choy's Breakfast, Lunch, Crab & Big Aloha Brewery
Snipes Mountain Microbrewery & Restaurant
description:
Walk between six tall lodge poles that flank the entrance of Snipes Mountain Brewery & Restaurant, push open the big double doors, and come on in. A unique pub and dining experience is waiting for you.

Find a seat at the oak bar, in front of the fireplace, or on the wrap-around patio.

Designed to reflect the surrounding countryside, there's plenty of wide open spaces for everyone. Separate banquet rooms are also available and children are always welcome!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
10 a.m. to 10 p.m. (Sun-Th)
11 a.m. to 11 p.m. (F-Sat)

name: Snoqualmie Falls Brewing Company
description:
We are a small private company, located in historic downtown Snoqualmie, Washington.  Founders Pat Anderson, David McKibben, Dave Eiffert, LeRoy Gmazel and Tom Antone did not have the sense to know that you had to be crazy to start a brewery in 1997, when most of the rest of the world thought the craft brewing industry was going down the tube, so 13 years later, here we are.

Our products are now available in 22 oz bombers at the brewery and in an ever increasing number of stores between Bellingham and Olympia, as well as in eastern Washington and northern Idaho.

name: Speakeasy Ales and Lagers
description: In a typically foggy San Francisco summer in 1997, we were determined to bring our unique West Coast-style beers from the underground to the masses. Defiantly producing small batches of beer in a secret warehouse in San Francisco’s long forgotten Butchertown District, we quickly gained a fiercely loyal following with bold, complex beers and striking 1920’s imagery. Starting with a single, iconic beer that immortalized the spirit of the bootleggers who persevered when America’s taps ran dry—a bold, hoppy amber ale known as Prohibition Ale—we now brew a wide array of acclaimed beers from hoppy pale ales to stouts aged in whiskey barrels. After 16 years of making great beer in the Bay Area, we have grown by leaps and bounds, yet we still produce many of our beers on the original steam-fired brewhouse that started it all.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu:	9:00 am - 10:00 am
Fri - Sat:	12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Springfield Brewing Company
description: An anchor to the re-birth of downtown Springfield since 1997, Springfield Brewing Company is a must-visit destination for beer and food enthusiasts traveling the area. Springfield Brewing Company is truly a wonderful facility, staffed with a great group of individuals. We bring together the finest brewing ingredients in one of the world’s best small brewing facilities to brew excellent beers. Local before local was cool, our kitchen matches our brewers passion for craft brewed beer with their made-from-scratch dishes with local products. We have no hatchet men or Madison Avenue suits on our staff; just a group of hard-working local business owners in search of excellence. Our mission is to brew inspired beer, produce excellent food, offer a superb facility while arming SBC with a personable staff. Cheers!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Tue: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm
Wed - Thu: 11:00 am - 12:00 am
Fri: 11:00 am - 1:00 am
Sat: 7:00 am - 1:00 am
Sun: 7:00 am - 12:00 am

name: SweetWater Brewing Company
description:
February 17, 1997 marked the official beginning of SweetWater Brewery, and a new style of brewing and selling beer in Atlanta as the boys wandered around Atlanta in an old van with Freddy's dog Badger. After ending up on the wrong side of the tracks a few times, they were finally pointed in the direction of Virginia-Highlands and found a few bars willing to take a chance on them. "We'll give you a shot as long as your dog stops begging for leftovers on our patio" was the cautious approval they needed to get the brand rolling.

SweetWater's second and current location is in Midtown Atlanta, adjacent to Ansley Park, in the Armour Circle Industrial Park just off of Piedmont and Monroe. The boys saved all of their pennies to buy the 25,000 square feet of brewing goodness and smack in the middle of all the action. Since the company began we've wanted to be closer to our homes, the bars and stores that sell our beer, and all the good folks that drink it. Fortunately seven years of great growth gave the company that opportunity. We learned a lot from that location and left all those mistakes behind as we built our new home. SweetWater Brewing Company has been here since 2004 and it feels good to be settled in. Our new home has enough capacity to brew 100,000 barrels of beer a year (A few more years at this rate.)

name: The Gahan House
description: The Gahan House located in historic downtown Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, is Charlottetown's authentic pub specializing in great pub fare and handcrafted ales. Follow us on twitter @gahanpub.

name: The People's Pint
description: Located at 24 Federal Street in Greenfield, The People's Pint has been open since January 1st, 1997. Since then, we've offered delicious food, quality ales & lagers, and friendly service. The Pint is open daily at 11 a.m. for lunch. The dinner menu is available from 4 - 10 p.m. and we have a late night menu from 10 p.m. - Midnight. We do not take reservations. All ages are welcome.

name: The Triple FFF Brewery
description:
Triple fff Brewery was founded in 1997 with the aim of brewing "Real ale that real ale drinkers drink!" 

The brewery near Alton in Hampshire started with two brews to its name. These two ales, Moondance and Comfortably Numb remain to this day among the most popular Triple fff beers. 
 
They have now been joined by other brews including Alton's Pride and Pressed Rat & Warthog along with some brand new recipes such as Jabberwocky and Ramble Tamble

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Tours available by request

name: The Zululand Brewery
description: The Zululand Brewery is a South African beer company founded in 1997 by the Chennells family. The Company is based in Eshowe, Zululand where Zulu Blonde Beer was originally brewed. The Zululand Brewery's flagship beer Zulu Blonde was launched internationally in 2010 where owner and brewmaster Richards Chennells brewed Zulu Blonde Export Ale at Marstons Brewery in Burton-upon-Trent in the UK to supply 800 pubs for the JDWetherspoons International REAL ALE FESTIVAL. Out of 50 different ales Zulu Blonde was voted number 1 and sold out in the first week of the three week festival. The Zululand brewmaster was invited back to the UK but this time brewed another 120 000 pints of the golden nectar at Everards brewery in Leicester to supply the 800 odd pub chain in time for the World Cup Kick off. Richard repeated the JDW REAL ALE FESTIVAL gig in 2012 where he brewed 100 000 pints at Caledonian Brewery in Edinburgh for what is known as the biggest Real Ale festival in the World. To date Zulu Blonde has sold over 330 000 pints of Zulu Blonde throughout the UK. Not bad for a beer from a small one horse town in Zululand...

name: Thirsty Dog Brewing Company
description:
Here at the Thirsty Dog Brewing Company, full flavor, delicate balance, texture & aroma combine to make beer an infinitely complex experience, and one that can be thoroughly enjoyable. Each of our beers are meticulously hand crafted in small batches using the finest ingredients. High quality malted barley is the source of the beer's sweetness & body. Select American & European hops are used to balance the malt sweetness, and , at times, add special flavors & aromas to the beer. Our careful selection of ingredients, along with specially designed recipes & brewing processes, give Thirsty Dog beers their unique flavor profiles that can be hard to find in today's mass market. one size fits all society.

Our microbrewed beers are far more diverse in range and character then the small spectrum of mass-marketed beers offered to the American public by the large national breweries. Enjoy the diversity, Unleash the flavor today., Welcome to Thirsty Dog Brewing Company, and welcome to great beer!

name: Three Rivers Eatery And Brewhouse
description:
The Three Rivers Eatery and Brewhouse was established in 1997 by John Silva, Bob and Cindy Beckley in Farmington, New Mexico. The restaurant and brewery is located in downtown Farmington, on 101 East Main Street. It was formerly called the Andrews Building, and was built and opened in 1912. It was built to house The Farmington Drug Store and The Farmington Times-Hustler Newspaper (now The Daily Times), which became the longest standing drugstore and fountain in New Mexico.

The unique decor consists mostly of priceless items found in the building during the renovation. Three Rivers believes in preserving their historical heritage of downtown Farmington. The restaurant was expanded in July, 1999. The addition includes an outdoor private patio, a bar, and the largest beer label and beer coaster collections in New Mexico. The restaurant has occupancy to provide for large party dining and special private parties. We also sell t-shirts, caps and 1/2 gallon jugs of all our brews.

name: Thunder Canyon Brewery
description:
Thunder Canyon Brewery, Located in the foothills Mall in Northwest Tucson opened in November of 1997.

Tucson's most award winning brewpub. Locally owned and independent.
 
Our objective is simple: We serve the finest, hand-crafted beers produced from a working, on-site brewery; we offer healthy, contemporary bistro-style cuisine; and we serve it all up in a fun, clean and friendly environment.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm
Thu - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am
Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Town Hall Brewery
description:
The Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery (Town Hall) opened in October 1997 after its founders graduated from business school and spent a couple of years in corporate America.

Town Hall founders Pete and Scot met as seventh graders at Kromrey Middle School in Middleton WI.  At the tender age of 13 both knew what they wanted to do for a living... make and drink good beer.  Just kidding!!

To make a long story short, Pete and Scot spent their formative years playing baseball at the West Middleton Town Hall.  Ever since, the words "Town Hall" evoke memories of community, relaxing with friends and happiness.  When Pete and Scot were reacquainted in Minneapolis they opened the Town Hall.

Tucked away on the fringes of downtown Minneapolis, the Town Hall offers a refreshing alternative to other eating and drinking establishments.  Its relaxed environment attracts a diverse crowd of college students, business people, professors, theater patrons and many more.

The Town Hall makes some of the best beer in America and provides an atmosphere where its patrons can relax and enjoy them.  Please come and taste our award winning beer and fantastic food.  Food and beverages are served in our bar, dining room and lounge.  Outdoor seating is available on our spacious patio from April 1 (weather permitting) until the snow flies in winter.

locations.name: Town Hall Tap
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday-Thursday: 11am – 1am
Friday: 11am – 2am
Saturday: 9am – 2am
Sunday: 10am – 12am

name: Trap Rock Restaurant and Brewery
description: Trap Rock Restaurant & Brewery opened its doors 1997 and combines seasonal craft brews with seasonal, American food. Designed by Morris Nathanson, Trap Rock Restaurant offers a working microbrewery and a comfortable European ski lodge atmosphere.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday-Thursday: 11:30AM-10PM
Friday-Saturday: 11:30AM-11PM
Sunday: 12 Noon-9PM

name: Tröegs Brewing Company
description:
Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale). 

In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery. 

In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works. 

The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others. 

Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.

Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews. 

Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.

www.troegs.com

name: Vermont Beer Company
description:
The Vermont Beer Co. can be found at The Perfect Pear CafÃ© in Bradford Vermont. Brewing beer on a 10 gallon system allows us to rotate our beers more often and makes us the smallest brewery in Vermont.

We serve our ales exclusively on draft on premise in The Perfect Pear Cafe dining room, out on our deck over-looking the Waits River and coming soon in our new Pub located just under the Pear.

Adam Coulter, enthusiastic home brewer and long time chef of The Perfect Pear has turned in his chef coat and turned his attention to upholding the tradition of brewing great beer in Vermont.

Featuring beers such as Waits River Red Ale, First Tap India Pale Ale & Devil's Den Brown Porter, The Pear offers two rotating house taps as well as two rotating guest taps showcasing some of the finest microbreweries from New England and beyond.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Open Lunch Tuesday-Saturday 11:30-2:00

Dinner - Tuesday- Saturday 5:00- 9:00

Pub - Tuesday-Saturday 2:00-Close

name: Wagner Valley Brewing Company
description:
Welcome to Wagner Valley Brewing Company, established in 1997. We are a small craft-brewing operation located in the Finger Lakes region of western New York. 

The brew system at Wagner's is an imported 20-BBL German-style, steam fired, four-vessel brew house, specifically designed for decoction mashing.

Wagner Valley Brewing Company is unique by adhering to the Reinheitsgebot of 1516, a German Purity Law that states: "Only the finest Malt, Hops, Yeast and Water can be used in the production of beer". This quality standard, used for our standard beers, in conjunction with with our Brewers' talent has resulted in Wagner Valley Brewing continuously winning the most prestigious of brewing awards, capturing numerous G.A.B.F., World Beer Cup and Tap New York medals.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Open Year Round for Tours, Tastings, & Sales, 10am-5pm Daily

We are closed only on Christmas, Thanksgiving & New Year’s Day

name: Walkabout Brewing Company
description:
Walkabout Brewing Company was established in 1997 in Central Point, Oregon by founder and head brewer, Ross Litton. A native of Perth, Australia, Ross has been a resident of Oregon for 21 years.

Walkabout brews have traditionally been available primarily in Southern Oregon; however distribution has now been expanded to include all Oregon and Southern Washington. The beers can be found on draft in bars and restaurants and in bottles at stores and markets.

 Walkabout bottles Worker's Pale Ale, Jabberwocky Strong Ale and Point the Bone IPA in 22oz bottles. Walkabout is distributed by Point Blank Distributing in Portland, Bend and the Willamette Valley, Summit Distributing in Southern Oregon, Bigfoot Distributing on the Oregon coast and by Alpha Distributing in Washington State.

Walkabout products are brewed in a 7 barrel brew house in Medford, Oregon. The brewery is not only a manufacturing facility but houses a tasting room with a large patio and outdoor area, dock sales are available.

name: Wet Dog Cafe & Astoria Brewing Company
description:
The Wet Dog Café was founded in 1995. The Brewery was added in 1997 under the name Pacific Rim Brewery. The name of the Brewery was changed to Astoria Brewing Co. in 2005 to commemorate Astoria’s First Brewing Company which was established in 1872. The Wet Dog was named after….the original owners dog…he loved the water and was always WET.

Our Brew Master uses only the finest ingredients to create our exceptional beers. Each beer is handcrafted using a wide range of hops & grains, thus creating unique flavors. It takes approximately 2 weeks for grain, water & hops to become our tasty brews. Our brewery has a 4 barrel system & in 2008 we added two 8 barrel fermenting tanks allowing us to produce over 800 barrels annually.

name: Wind River Brewing Company
description:
Wind River Brewing Company is located at the base of the Wind River Mountains in downtown Pinedale, Wyoming. Our brewery is the spot for those who appreciate the art of handcrafted superior brews with a wide range of flavors and notes. We brew award winning beers, created in-house using only the finest ingredients and pure glacier water.

"We are known for having legendary beer and the best food in town." If you're looking for a quick bite to eat or want to relax and sample our entire selection of beer we welcome you to join us at Wind River Brewing Co.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Sunday - Thursday: 11 a.m. - 11 p.m.
Friday & Saturday: 11 a.m. - Midnight

name: Wolaver's Fine Organic Ales
description:
Our brewery is dedicated to brewing great tasting beers, supporting sustainable agriculture, and minimizing our impact on the environment.

100% Organic Hops and Malts

name: Wolf Creek Restaurant and Brewery
description: Wolf Creek Brewery was founded as a brewpub in 1997 as "Wolf Creek Restaurant & Brewing Co." by Rob and Laina McFerren.  Brewer, Rob, has won many awards for his varied beer styles, including "Howlin' Hefeweizen" (Bavarian Hef) and "Midnight Howl" and India Black Ale.  In 2013, they expanded brewery operations and built a production facility in the Mann-Biomedical Park in Valencia.  June 2nd, 2014 marks the date of their first bottling run.  Cheers!

name: Woodward Avenue Brewers
description: Woodward Avenue Brewers, or “WAB”, as we're affectionately called, is much more than a restaurant or bar. Established in 1997, The WAB has become a landmark along Woodward Avenue in Ferndale and has welcomed visitors – those in the neighborhood and those far and wide – for more than 16 years. Pioneers of the craft brew scene, WAB is the go-to gathering place for patrons to enjoy handcrafted brews, great food, friendly atmosphere and the action on historic Woodward Avenue.

name: Yukon Brewing
description:
Yukon Brewing opened its doors in 1997 under the name Chilkoot Brewing Co. Ltd. Owners Alan and Bob conceived their idea like many Yukon babies – around a campfire on a canoe trip. Both Ontario natives, they’ve lived and worked in the Territory for a good deal of their adult lives.

From that inaugural conversation grew plans for a craft brewery that would service the north with quality beer while keeping jobs and money in the territory.

Over a decade later Yukon Brewing, as it is called today, continues to work towards that goal. Employing a dozen or so staff (more in the busy summer months), Yukon Brewing actively supports countless Yukon events and causes each year.

Bob and Alan continue as owners and chief operators, growing the company outside the Yukon. The breweries 8 packaged beers are available across Alberta and BC with some even finding their way as far east as Quebec and at the Hannover Zoo in Germany.
